ethnicGroups.name: Baoulé
ethnicGroups.traditionalArt: Wooden masks, gold jewelry, woven textiles
ethnicGroups.customs: Matrilineal society, elaborate funeral ceremonies, royal traditions
ethnicGroups.description: The Baoulé are known for their intricate wood carvings and gold jewelry, with a rich tradition of storytelling and royal heritage.

ethnicGroups.name: Agni
ethnicGroups.traditionalArt: Gold weights, ceremonial stools, kente cloth
ethnicGroups.customs: Royal traditions, elaborate chieftaincy, ancestral worship
ethnicGroups.description: The Agni people maintain strong royal traditions and are renowned for their gold craftsmanship and colorful kente cloth.

ethnicGroups.name: Malinké
ethnicGroups.traditionalArt: Mud cloth, musical instruments, leather work
ethnicGroups.customs: Griot tradition, oral history, Islamic practices
ethnicGroups.description: The Malinké are famous for their griot tradition of oral history and their distinctive mud cloth designs.

ethnicGroups.name: Bété
ethnicGroups.traditionalArt: Zaouli masks, wooden statues, raffia textiles
ethnicGroups.customs: Secret societies, initiation rites, community gatherings
ethnicGroups.description: The Bété are known for their spectacular Zaouli mask dances and rich tradition of wood carving.

ethnicGroups.name: Sénufo
ethnicGroups.traditionalArt: Poro masks, bronze casting, wooden statues
ethnicGroups.customs: Poro society, agricultural rituals, initiation ceremonies
ethnicGroups.description: The Sénufo are renowned for their Poro society masks and exceptional bronze casting techniques.

ethnicGroups.name: Dioula
ethnicGroups.customs: Trading traditions, Islamic practices, merchant networks
ethnicGroups.description: The Dioula are historically traders and are known for their extensive merchant networks across West Africa.

ethnicGroups.name: Abron
ethnicGroups.customs: Royal drums, ancestral worship, traditional healing
ethnicGroups.description: The Abron maintain strong royal traditions and are skilled in traditional pottery and textile production.

ethnicGroups.name: Dida
ethnicGroups.traditionalArt: Raffia textiles, wood carving, basket weaving
ethnicGroups.customs: Fishing rituals, community gatherings, traditional fishing
ethnicGroups.description: The Dida are known for their expertise in fishing and their beautiful raffia textile production.

ethnicGroups.name: Lobi
ethnicGroups.traditionalArt: Terracotta statues, iron work, architectural traditions
ethnicGroups.description: The Lobi are famous for their distinctive terracotta statues and unique architectural traditions.

ethnicGroups.name: Yacouba
ethnicGroups.traditionalArt: Sacred masks, stilt dancing, ritual objects
ethnicGroups.customs: Stilt dancing traditions, secret societies, initiation rites
ethnicGroups.description: The Yacouba are renowned for their spectacular stilt dancing and intricate sacred mask traditions.

ethnicGroups.name: Abouré
ethnicGroups.customs: Queen mother tradition, fishing rites, coastal traditions
ethnicGroups.description: The Abouré maintain unique queen mother traditions and have rich coastal cultural practices.

ethnicGroups.name: Wobé
ethnicGroups.traditionalArt: Facial masks, ceremonial doors, ritual objects
ethnicGroups.customs: Divination practices, healing rituals, forest traditions
ethnicGroups.description: The Wobé are known for their intricate facial masks and deep knowledge of traditional healing practices.

ethnicGroups.name: Kulango
ethnicGroups.customs: Agricultural rites, smithing traditions, seasonal rituals
ethnicGroups.description: The Kulango are skilled potters and iron smiths with rich agricultural traditions.

ethnicGroups.name: Mauka
ethnicGroups.traditionalArt: Leather work, musical instruments, hunting tools
ethnicGroups.description: The Mauka maintain strong hunting traditions and are known for their leather craftsmanship.

ethnicGroups.name: Ahizi
ethnicGroups.traditionalArt: Fishing nets, canoe carving, lagoon crafts
ethnicGroups.customs: Lagoon fishing, water spirits worship, boat building
ethnicGroups.description: The Ahizi are expert lagoon fishermen with unique water-based cultural traditions.
